solution_line_template: Tyson scored {points_per_three_score} points {times_three_score} times, which would be {points_per_three_score} * {times_three_score} = <<{points_per_three_score}*{times_three_score}={points_from_three_score}>>{points_from_three_score} points.

He also scored {points_per_two_score} points {times_two_score} times, which would give him a score of {points_per_two_score} * {times_two_score} = <<{points_per_two_score}*{times_two_score}={points_from_two_score}>>{points_from_two_score}.

So Tyson scored {total_score} - {points_from_three_score} - {points_from_two_score} = <<{total_score}-{points_from_three_score}-{points_from_two_score}={points_from_one_score}>>{points_from_one_score} points, by one point each.
